main event: A bright object was observed flashing away south of Harrisburg, Pennsylvania on February 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as brilliant and flashing quickly away,There were multiple hypotheses about the nature of the object including balloon, aircraft, and astronomical phenomena,The sighting was reported by a pilot from Flying Tigers flight 939,There were no other reports received pertaining to this sighting,The identity of the pilot remains unknown.
witness description: The pilot of Flying Tigers flight 939.
